comments:
Error while deploying a newly packaged Plugin

I am trying to add Oracle Webervice Stack support for the Eclipse Framework via WTP Framework.
I have the some code working , which i was trying to package as a plugin and to be tested out.

I used the export plugin option and created the plug-in and deployed the same in other Instance.

In the fresh Eclipse Envirnoment
While importing the plug in as source project and debug as Workspace Plugin 
all the class loading works fine and i am able to generated the artificats.


but when i uncheck the new Plugin from Workspace Plugin and check the same in Target plugin , 

Any help in resovling the issues would of great help.

Configuration Details , osgi log and exception log are furnished.


i get the following error

IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.

Tithosh,
I agree the loader for bundle org.eclipse.jst.ws.oracle.creation.ui cannot find org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.oracle.creation.ui.wsrt.OracleWebServiceRuntime. To clarify, are you saying that your plugin loads and runs OK when you launch Eclipse from your PDE, but not when you export your plugin in binary form and install it into a standalone Eclipse? If so, my first guess is that your build.properties file may be incorrect. Check the contents of your exported plugin to make sure your .class files are in there. If allowable, could you please attach your build.properties and manifest.mf files to this bug so I can take a look?

Is there any other information in .log concerning any plugins (bundles) that Eclipse failed to load?

Also, what exact version of Eclipse WTP are you using?

Another possibility is your class may depend, directly or indirectly, on another class from another bundle that could not be loaded which - in most cases I've seen - is due to the directly or indirectly required bundle not being listed under the Require-Bundle property.

Eg.: http://www.eclipsezone.com/eclipse/forums/m91993794.html

Thanks for the response .
the plug in contains the class files. I double checked it with the plug in jar.
